instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message:
Hi guys,

Got this macbook with wine damage.

After ultra sonic clear all seems to be ok. There were corrision under <TRANSISTOR>Q7430</TRANSISTOR>/7560/7520 the where gone after cleaning.


Now getting all rails ok.

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shoted to ground.



<CHIP>U7501</CHIP> seems to be ok.



P.S. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> must be shorted from any other line. When inject 5V the short is gone and nothing getting warm. From magsafe that 5V is not created.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message:
"From magsafe that 5V is not created."
???

"<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shoted to ground."
Which is the exact value, on 200ohm scale?
Lift one pin of L7520 and see where remains the low value.
If value increrases after injecting voltage, usually bad ceramic cap.
Inspect all caps from that rail; possibly note some colour change of one...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message:
[B]"<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shoted to ground." [/B] Only when magsafe is pluged. Unplug it and the short is gone and resistance to ground are about 4 mln
[B]Which is the exact value, on 200ohm scale? [/B]19.6 ohms
[B]Lift one pin of L7520 and see where remains the low value.[/B] Pin 1 is lower 19,6, Pin 2 - 5.5Khms
[B]If value increrases after injecting voltage, usually bad ceramic cap[/B]. Actually it decrease after injecting till getting in short with ground.
.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message:
"[B]"<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shoted to ground." [/B] Only when magsafe is pluged"
NEVER ever check continuity (diode mode, or ohm scale) on a powered board!!!

So post again the value (diode mode) without any power on board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message: You mean post all reails values or just <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message:
Post the value for supposed short.
No charger, no battery connected of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message: On L7520 ( with pin 1 lifted) i got  19.6ohms  on Pin 1 and 5.5khoms on pin 2

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message: Diode mode ( red to ground) Pin1 : 418 Pin 2 : 398

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message:
"i got 19.6ohms on Pin 1
---------------
Diode mode ( red to ground) Pin1 : 418"
No idea what you do wrong; impossible to get such difference...

No need to lift L7520 if no short there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message: i dont know. I put my tester in Diode icon, put red on ground black on pin 1/2 and getting 0.405 ( sorry not 418)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message:
When you get 19.6 ohms then?
That is aprox 010 in diode mode...
Please provide accurate information...
Seems that there is no short at all.

Do you get magsafe light?
Post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3V42 voltages.
Check <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> presence.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message:
Let's start again:)

I get green/orange light on charger:

Rails:


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.6V
<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> - 20 V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.42V
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> - 0V / Diode mode: 0.408 / Resistance to ground: 0.5mhoms
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> - 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> - 0V / Diode mode: 0.475 / Resistance to ground 1,5 mhoms
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> - 3.3V

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL> 0V

No visible damage on board. It had been cleaned in ultrasonic.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message: Post now <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> and check if <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> reacts when <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is triggered; use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> 0v



while posting this message the fan begin to spin and cpu got warm disconected magsafe and conected again few times and fans begin to spin every time. . Mounted it in chasis and not working again. 

<SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>  3.4 V is droped 0V and back again 3.4 when <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is triggered

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message:
Test the board without anything else connected.
Use USB OSX pendrive with LED link to assure USB activity; USB mouse serves normally.
If works, start to connect perypheral devices, untill board doesn't start again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message: Now i have it out of chasis. And back again to same problem. not turning. conected usb mouse and pen and it doesnt work. No light

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not turnin on. <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> shorted to ground
threads.message: THanks informaticos. Problem solved changing SMC.

I think this because board worked good before.
Didn't try to reball it?
